div.l: Our hors is lost aleyn for cokkis banys
Steep on thy feet come of man alle at anys
Allas our wardeyn hath hys palfrey lorn
Thys aleyn al forgat bothe mele and corn
Al was out of mynde hys husbondry
What whylk wey is he gon he gan crye
The wyf come rennynge ynward at a renne
She sayd allas your hors goth to fenne
Wyth wylde maris / as faste as he may go
Vnthank come on hys hand that bond hym so
And he that bettyr shold haue knyt the reyne
Allas quod Iohn allas for crystis peyne
Ley doun thy swerd and I wyl myn alswa
I is ful swyfte / god woot as is a raa
Be godis sale he shal not ascape vs bathe
Why ne had thou put the capyl in the lathe
Ille hayl be god aleyn thou is a fonne
These sely clerkis haue wel faste y ronne
Toward the fenne bothe aleyn and eke Iohn
And when the myllere saw they were goon
He half a busshel of her flour hath take
And bad hys wyf go knede it in a cake
He sayd I trow the clerkis were aferd
Yet can a myllere make a clerkis berd
For al her art yet let hem go her wey
Lo where they goon so lat the chyldren pley
They gete hym nought so lyghtly by my croun
Thyse sely clerkis rennyn vp and dounn
Wyth kepe kepe stond stond Iossa ware derere
Ga whystle thou there ⁊and I shal kepe hym here
But shortly tyl it was veryly nyght
They coude not though they dede al her myght
Her capyl catche he ran alwey so faste
Tyl in a dyche they caughte hym at the laste
Wery and weet as best is in the rayn
Comyth Iohn the clerk ⁊and with hym come aleyn
Allas quod Iohn the day that I was born
Now are we dryuen tyl hethyng ⁊and tyl scorn
